column2: Admin user's password hash (use command "openssl passwd -1 PASSWORD" to get the PASSWORD's hash) (optional)
Provide at least 2 private subnet IDs in the chosen VPC, separated by commas (e.g. subnet-0d72417c,subnet-1f61306f,subnet-1061d06f)
Turn on/off the Intrusion Prevention System, Application Control, Anti-Virus and Anti-Bot Blades (additional Blades can be manually turned on later)
The tag must be up to 12 alphanumeric character
Secure Internal Communication activation key should contain only alpha numeric characters and be at least 8 characters long
Notifications about scaling events will be sent to this email address (optional)

[{u'Parameters': [u'VPC', u'Protocol', u'ServicePort', u'Certificate', u'ExternalLoadBalancerType', u'AdminEmail', u'KeyPairName', u'Tag'], u'Label': {u'default': u'General Settings'}}, {u'Parameters': [u'GatewaysSubnets', u'GatewaysInstanceType', u'GatewaysMinSize', u'GatewaysMaxSize', u'GatewaysLicense', u'GatewaysPasswordHash', u'GatewaysSIC', u'GatewayAllowUploadDownload'], u'Label': {u'default': u'Check Point CloudGuard IaaS Security Gateways Auto Scaling Group Configuration'}}, {u'Parameters': [u'ManagementDeploy', u'ManagementInstanceType', u'ManagementLicense', u'ManagementPasswordHash', u'GatewaysPolicy', u'GatewaysBlades', u'AdminAddressCIDR', u'GatewaysAddresses'], u'Label': {u'default': u'Check Point CloudGuard IaaS Security Management Server Configuration'}}, {u'Parameters': [u'ServersDeploy', u'ServersSubnets', u'ServersInstanceType', u'ServersAMI'], u'Label': {u'default': u'Web Servers Auto Scaling Group Configuration'}}]
The internal Load Balancer should listen to this port
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an HTTPS Certificate, ignored if the selected protocol is HTTP

The name that represents the configuration template. Configurations required to automatically provision the Gateways in the Auto Scaling Group, such as what Security Policy to install and which Blades to enable, will be placed under this template name
The EC2 Key Pair to allow SSH access to the instances created by this stack
Must be a valid email address
Admin user's password hash (use command "openssl passwd -1 PASSWORD" to get the PASSWORD's hash) (optional)
Subnet IDs must be in the form subnet-xxxxxxxx or subnet-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx, separated by commas without spaces
The URL of the external Application Load Balancer
Custom service port must be a number between 0 and 65535
The minimal number of Security Gateways
The name that represents the controller. Configurations required to connect to your AWS environment, such as credentials and regions, will be placed under this controller name
Amazon Machine Image ID must be in the form ami-xxxxxxxx or ami-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
The external Load Balancer listens to this port. Leave this field blank to use default ports: 80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS
The Secure Internal Communication key creates trusted connections between Check Point components. Choose a random string consisting of at least 8 alphanumeric characters
The name of the Security Policy package to be installed on the gateways in the Security Gateways Auto Scaling group
The name that represents the Security Management Server
The license to install on the Security Gateways
[{u'Value': u'${Tag}-management', u'Key': u'x-chkp-management'}, {u'Value': u'${Tag}-template', u'Key': u'x-chkp-template'}]
The Amazon Machine Image ID of a preconfigured web server (e.g. ami-0dc7dc63)
The URL of the external Network Load Balancer
The tag is used by the Security Management Server to automatically provision the Security Gateways. Must be up to 12 alphanumeric characters and unique for each Quick Start deployment
Select at least 2 public subnets in the VPC. If you choose to deploy a Security Management Server it will be deployed in the first subnet
The maximal number of Security Gateways
The license to install on the Security Management Server
Select 'No' to use an existing Security Management Server or to deploy one later and to ignore the other parameters of this section
Automatically download Blade Contracts and other important data. Improve product experience by sending data to Check Point
Use Network Load Balancer if you wish to preserve the source IP address and Application Load Balancer if you wish to perform SSL Offloading
Allow web, SSH, and graphical clients only from this network to communicate with the Security Management Server
Allow gateways only from this network to communicate with the Security Management Server
Must be the name of an existing EC2 KeyPair
[{u'ToPort': [u'ProvidedPort', u'ServicePort', [u'HTTP', u'80', u'443']], u'FromPort': [u'ProvidedPort', u'ServicePort', [u'HTTP', u'80', u'443']], u'IpProtocol': u'tcp', u'CidrIp': u'0.0.0.0/0'}]
Must be a valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN), for example: arn:aws:iam::123456789012:server-certificate/web-server-certificate
Select 'Yes' to deploy web servers and an internal Application Load Balancer. If you select 'No' the other parameters of this section will be ignored
